laboratory_examinations.findings: Best-corrected visual acuity ranged from 20/30 to 2 feet/200 (mean, 20/112; logMAR 0.75).
Color vision averaged 4.0/10 plates correctly identified (range, 0–10).
Demonstrated central or paracentral scotomas in seven of the eight patients.
Normal intraocular pressures (mean, 15.0 mmHg; range, 10–19 mmHg).
Cup-to-disc ratio of more than 0.5 observed in at least one eye of eight patients. Temporal pallor was observed in all eyes.
